name: Hector Geffner
content: Hector Geffner's Home Page Hector Geffner I'm an Alexander von Humboldt Professor at the Computer Science Department, RWTH Aachen University, Germany, where I head the Chair of Machine Learning and Reasoning. My current address is: Hector Geffner Chair of Machine Learning and Reasoning RWTH Aachen Theaterstr. 35-39 52062 Aachen Germany +49 241 80-21601 (Phone) firstname.lastname@ml.rwth-aachen.de Index Teaching Opportunities Symposium Software Papers Short Bio Teaching Course: Actions and Planning in AI: Learning, Models, and Algorithms (Summer Semesters) Course: Social and Technological Change Seminar Advanced Topics in Reinforcement Learning and Planning Opportunities I lead a research group at on learning to act and plan with funding from the ERC, the Humboldt Foundation, and RWTH Aachen. There are still openings for highly motivated and talented postdocs, but I'm not taking new PhD students or interns Symposium We organize a yearly Aachen Symposium on Representation learning to act and plan (RLeap) Software Software and example files for each of the papers should be available from co-author pages; if not, feel free to request them by email Papers, Talks, Slides, Books Learning Lifted STRIPS Models from Action Traces Alone: A Simple, General, and Scalable Solution.
